predicate.note: Frames file for 'choke' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.

roleset.name: to have or cause to have difficulty in breathing

example.name: non-agentive
example.text: They also chart the evolution of a city that [*T*-1] has grown tenfold in the author 's lifetime , from a colonial outpost of fez-wearing pashas to a Third World slum choking on its own refuse .

example.name: agentive
example.text: Why , he used [*-1] to lay in wait for Cap ; suddenly he 'd leap from behind some statue of Marshall onto Cap 's chest and grab him by the throat and choke him till he coughed up an additional $ 2 billion [*U*] or so .
example.arg: till he coughed up an additional $ 2 billion [*U*] or so

example.name: transitive
example.text: This is no place for pedestrians , but at 7:30 on a recent morning , when construction choked traffic at the famous Four Corners intersection to one lane [*T*-1] , a taxi passenger found it [*EXP*-2] faster [*] to abandon the cab and walk to her destination .
example.arg: traffic at the famous Four Corners intersection

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*-3] Fending off attacks on his economic policies in a House of Commons debate yesterday , Mr. Lawson said [0] inflation `` remains the greatest threat to our economic well-being '' and promised [*-3] to take `` whatever steps [*T*-2] are needed [*-1] '' [*] to choke it off .
